article.title: Search for lepton flavour violating decays of the Higgs boson to $μτ$ and e$τ$ in proton-proton collisions at $\sqrt s=$ 13 TeV

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 1, which variable shows the clearest distinction between the signal (H → µτ<sub>h</sub>) and the background in the 0-jet category?

In the distributions of input variables for the BDT in the H → µτ<sub>e</sub> channel (Figure 2), which background process exhibits a shape most similar to the signal for the M<sub>T</sub>(µ) variable?
Figure 3 shows the M<sub>col</sub> distribution in three different control samples. Which control sample is particularly relevant for validating the background estimation of the tt + jets process?

The provided formulas express the decay width (Γ) and branching fraction (B) for the lepton flavor violating Higgs decay H → αβ. What key assumption about the Higgs boson is incorporated in the branching fraction formula?
choices: Dominant decay to bottom quarks (H → bb)
